content.text:
# Draft:2025 Tokara Islands earthquake swarm

* This article is better than the existing one! I'm sorry I could not accept it. Here are two additional sources to consider adding, if you want to: [https://www.dw.com/en/japan-steps-up-earthquake-tsunami-defenses-amid-quake-swarm/a-73212735 DW Japan steps up tsunami defenses due to quake swarm] and [https://www3.nhk.or.jp/nhkworld/en/news/20250721_07/ NHK (English) Japan's Tokara island chain, 1 month of quake swarm]. Thank you for your submission to Afc.--FeralOink (talk) 10:07, 24 July 2025 (UTC)
----
| meandepth =
| type = Strike-slip
| affected = Tokara Islands
| image = JMA 20250703 1613.png
| caption = Map of JMA seismic intensities for the 3 July 16:13 event
| map = )}}

| events = ≥2,171 felt≥1,841 over M2.5≥78 over M4.5
}}
The 2025 Tokara Islands earthquake swarm is an ongoing earthquake swarm. With over 2,100 earthquakes occurring within the span of a month, it is the largest earthquake swarm occurring in the region in recent history.

Response
The earthquake swarm has prompted evacuations from the islands of Akusekijima and Kodakarajima.
